this business and run like one. 
security important your safety big priority for customers and myself. 
all precautions are taken very seriously from the start beginning with using secure and highly regarded pgp tool with extremely strong password for decryption. 
the computer that used was bought with cash hard drive was remove and only boots from encrypted memory card. 
this computer never touches the clear net has also has never been exposed any java script and never will. 
hardware and software firewalls are used. 
never store any your information aside from the order number and the corresponding tracking number which are kept encrypted and well hidden. 
this information deleted using very through piece software soon the order has arrived. 
packaging done the utmost clean environment.

all postage bought with cash from locations where near the places your orders are dropped.

every package employs decoy. 
while packing quality gloves are worn every step the way and are changed frequently throughout the process. 
stealth something take seriously. 
i've done this for long time and have never had package seized. 
have been vendor for several years many markets and have done without incident. 
won't state prior usernames for security reasons.

have never acted dishonest scammed stolen anyway from anyone online real life. 
it's just not something could and still sleep night. 
even when there have been incidents seized sites like exit scams have always honored the pending orders placed even though loose money those customers also lost money and feel like they should get what they paid for least what they tried pay for.

will give you warning that they are not authenticated. 
click authenticate buddy and manual fingerprint verification. 
have them send you copy their otr fingerprint either through email the forums encrypted with your pgp key. 
once you have made sure that the fingerprints match click authenticate buddy. 
this point you are communicating real time with perfect forward secrecy. 
this means that every chat session has unique key and unlike email they cannot back and decrypt your chats even they recover your otr key. 
mixing the tor hidden service plus otr provides you complete anonymity privacy and plausible deniability. 
this method does not use hidden service for file transfers but all file transfers are routed over tor. 
would not accept file transfers unless you completely trust the person sending the file. 
anyone wants chat send. 
this tutorial uses chaos computer clubs hidden service but you can substitute any other hidden jabber service.

java much different than javascript. 
javascript lightweight computer programming language scripting language that allows small scripts programs run over the web. 
java basically programming language for portable cross platform computer programs. 
cracking someone else's wifi won't really help you much and don't condone using other individuals' internet connections for illegal activity. 
how would you feel one day police broke down your door and arrested you for absolutely reason other than someone living half block from you had poor opsec learning properly test attack and break into someone's network takes lots time and fair understanding networking and can get you trouble well. 
vpn not the same. 
stands for virtual machine which program that used create virtual computer inside the memory your physical computer. 
vpn stands for virtual private network. 
this service provided many companies where and this very basic explanation all incoming and outgoing information first sent through remote server. 
hides your internet usage from your isp internet service provider. 
was able get tails set hour last night with this.

tails not secure for serious dnm activities and here's the first reason why. 
com tech policy tor director fbi paid carnegie mellon break tor hand over ips the usa feds have already conducted tor attacks that have landed significant dnm figures behind bars the above article has more details about how the feds did and who they have arrested far former silk road lieutenant for starters. 
also tor bridges are practically useless for hiding from the nsa because the nsa harvests the tor bridge addresses from the emails send from the tor project. 
panorama aktuell nsa page. 
htmlso the nsa knows you're using tor anyways you're using tor bridge. 
tor bridges were designed for people repressive third world countries not citizens hiding from the nsa. 
also gets worse and this information that every dnm user serious small should know about but since the edward snowden leaks the nsa has talked about not bragged that they have timing attacks for anonymizing tor users. 
com tor spooks tor the nsa the washington post revealed that the nsa had figured out various ways unmasking and penetrating the anonymity the tor network. 
since according page research paper titled simply tor the agency has worked several methods that successful would allow the nsa uncloak anonymous traffic wide scale effectively watching communications they enter and exit the tor system rather than trying follow them inside. 
one type attack for example would identify users minute differences the clock times their computers. 
and still gets worse. 
tor prioritizes fast relays and you consider that plausibly speaking many and possibly most the most high speed tor relays are run western intelligence agencies and not just grassroots tor volunteers makes timing attacks much easier for them. 
com article from above quotein tor founder roger dingledine revealed that the tor network configured prioritize speed and route traffic through through the fastest servers nodes available. 
result the vast bulk tor traffic runs through several dozen the fastest and most dependable servers today's network clients choose one the fastest exit relays around the time and their choices come from pool relays. 
this information above has already been public since the edward snowden leaks now everyone reading this has excuse not get off tails and learn ubuntu your other favorite flavor linux and start using reputable vpn impeccable track record standing against government requests keeps logs and you can pay them bitcoins. 
you can start this now end like the silk road lieutenant who got arrested because his tor connection got anonymized the government what was probably his home address.

this not acceptable solution for power users.

add that only plug never use wifi. 
the travel router connected the wan port from ethernet over power extender and then wired through the lan port into machine.

feel more secure have content keys keymanager etc.

net recv keys you can verify that this key says tor browser developers and that you didn't typo running this command you like quotegpg fingerprint this will output something like quotepub expires key fingerprint uid tor browser developers signing key. 
org sub expires sub expires then this the signature verify command assuming you are the directory where you saved both these files quotegpg verify tor browser linux. 
asc tor browser linux. 
should say something like quotegpg good signature from tor browser developers signing key. 
then run tor browser hardened it's honestly just easy extracting the.

will have made folder called tor browser now change directories there and run the start tor browser.

browser start tor browser detach'.

might useful some users remember basic gpg commands without the need the clearnet creating new keygpg gen keybrowsing your keyring list all public keys gpg list public keys list all private keys gpg list secret keys list everyone who has signed key gpg list sig xkeyid get the full fingerprint gpg fingerprint xkeyid exporting export your public key file gpg armor export xkeyid upload key the keyserver. 
good for new keys after signing someone else's using the default key server gpg send keys xkeyid specifying key server gpg keyserver sks. 
send keys xkeyid export backup you private key gpg armor export secret keys xkeyid searching for key finding someones key using the default key server gpg search keys user email. 
com specifying key server gpg keyserver sks. 
search keys user email. 
comimporting private key copy and paste the private key private. 
key then gpg allow secret key import import private. 
keyexport private key into file gpg export secret keys gpg aco privatekey. 
asccreates file called privatekey. 
asc with the encrypted and ascii armored representation the private key for the entered. 
asc export name domain. 
comoutputs your public key ascii armored file publickey. 
asc replacing name domain. 
com with the email address for your key. 
encrypting decrypting encrypt file for someone their email gpg encrypt filename. 
txt recipient user email. 
com encrypt file for multiplie people their email addresses it's usually good idea encyrpt your own key well you will not able decrypt the file later gpg encrypt filename. 
com recipient user email. 
com encrypt file for transmission over text email irc jabber etc. 
gpg armour encrypt filename. 
com gpg recipient recipient file. 
txt decrypting file gpg output filename. 
ascimport keys importing from text file gpg import publickey. 
asc restore backup private key gpg allow secret key import import privatekey. 
ascdelete private key gpg delete secret key username this deletes the secret key from your secret key ring. 
delete public key gpg delete key username removes the public key associated with username from your public key ring but only there associated private key. 
keys maintenance revoking creating revocation certificate. 
you must have the private key this you have lost your private key well thats when problems kick gpg output revoke. 
asc gen revoke xkeyid revoke the key all you need import the revoke. 
asc into your keyring gpg import revoke. 
asc make sure everyone knows your keys been revoked you need publish the updated public key gpg keyserver sks. 
send keys xkeyid keys maintenance key signing you need edit the key gpg edit key xkeyidfrom here 'help' will give you list your options but sign key you can ether type 'sign' 'tsign'. 
the man pages give better indication what the difference 'man gpg' but 'sign' usually sufficent. 
after they key signed type 'save' and 'quit' then you can ether send the key keyserver for download its owner export the public key and send other means this usually means encrypted email. 
signing and verifying files sign file with your default key use this gpg detach sign armour filename. 
txt verify signed file but put the output from above filename. 
asc gpg verify filename. 
ascif you need more detailed information and are using linux man gpg will give you that you can also ask any question this thread create another one.

from vitaminlsd june pmquote from gleeful june pmquote from vitaminlsd june amtails not secure for serious dnm activities and here's the first reason why. 
com tor spooks what does this breach have with tails isn't just live version linux because it's not designed used with vpn and that vpns are the safest way access tor i'm not disputing what you're saying just don't understand. 
basically yea you want always use vpn before tor. 
and tails doesn't have built vpn support unless you're using vpn router like how cosmic consciousness explained then your tor connection ever gets anonymized they would see your home wherever you're connected from and that itself has been enough land some unlucky people jail and prison like the silk road lieutenant from that article. 
the nsa even brags about how can anonymize tor users not using vpn first like going out and having sex with women night without condom and hoping you don't get std after year. 
one the worst ways you can anonymized like this tor basically uses three hops send your data the final destination. 
node the first node the guard node node the middle node node the exit node. 
com through tor using the same username you buy with the markets with your connection without vpn would look like your home tor node tor node tor node redditbut you got unlucky and the government runs all three those tor nodes and your tor prioritizes the fastest tor nodes tor node would know your home but not the contents your connection. 
tor node would also know that it's sending data tor node tor node knows that received connection from tor node although doesn't know what the contents are tor node also knows that its sending data tor node tor node finally sends your data reddit. 
tor node can always see your data plaintext for any website not just reddit unless that connection the website used. 
even your web traffic reddit all sent over encrypted the reddit server tor node knows that this one the reddit servers for instance because the connection during the ssl tls handshake the reddit server openly says says before everything gets encrypted that this server belongs reddit. 
reddit has been put under some type government gag order give all addresses login times the feds the feds would know you logged through tor. 
but the feds are doing anonymization attacks right now tor node was one their own they could see this connection reddit. 
and tor node knows received connection from tor node and tor node knows made connection tor node. 
likewise roll this back one more time tor node knows that received connection from tor node and tor node knows that made connection tor node very specific point time down the second. 
then finally tor node knows this connection came from your home address. 
this how the feds can anonymize you they control your entire tor circuit your tor node. 
but the nsa even brags that can anonymize people just based off when you made your tor connection combined with when the request came out the tor exit node it's possibly they don't even need control your entire tor circuit for that connection. 
just run one the tor node and use their nsa mass surveillance visibility know when connection came out one the tor nodes. 
plus they can combine this roughly with the size the encrypted data being sent back you narrow down how large the page you viewed was which can help them pinpoint you even closer with this second method. 
think the second one sloppier but the nsa was caught bragging from information the edward snowden leaks that this method still works.

found this discussion and thought you may find interesting. 
quotethe first thing you have ask what problem you're trying solve using vpn instead addition tor. 
generally people use vpns either encrypt their traffic from their isp engage membership concealment your isp can't profile you tor user. 
vpns are extremely weak website fingerprinting attacks since all websites don't pad their encrypted packets the same size. 
with vpn adversary can identify with probability you're visiting certain preidentified website despite your traffic being encrypted. 
i've never seen vpn which has been tested having its encrypted traffic being fingerprinted with less than certainty. 
tor pads all packets bytes which significantly strengthens against fingerprinting attacks. 
also tor encrypts your traffic anyway and provides excellent membership concealment the form transport layer protocol obfuscators like obfsproxy and skypemorph. 
when you use vpn you're revealing that you're using anonymizer tor can configured try hide the fact that you're using anonymizer all. 
already there's real reason use vpn since all their advantages are exceeded tor. 
using vpn connect tor means that you're absolutely fucked your vpn compromised since passive attacker can just wiretap you before your entry point enough said. 
it's especially bad idea use vpn you found advertised drug fraud forum entry point this favored tactic law enforcement once they've flipped somebody. 
you use tor connect vpn you're now deanonymizing yourself other ways. 
you visit site like mtgox pecunix any log gathering site you've now linked service you're paying for maybe via credit card but still bad even you're paying with bitcoins your operations. 
commercial services should never used endpoints because historically most vpns see hidemyass vpnbook voxility safe mail etc. 
are forced the feds give their customers after enough time court. 
tor all you need preferably with protocol obfuscator. 
there's never been record anybody using tor for any illegal activity being identified the most secure pedos carders hackers who have ever been pwnt from shadowcrew geohot and countless others were pwnt because their use ssh tunnels vpn services. 
also please check out this thread tor talk. 
org pipermail tor talk january. 
html and pay special attention anything said arma the lead developer tor. 
vpns are bad vpn tor useless and can very bad tor vpn very bad tor fucking awesome. 
you're playing the game picking vpn based how privacy conscious they seem where they're located you've already lost. 
said several vpns that advertise themselves prioritizing privacy and even accept bitcoins payment option such hma are known comply with title interception orders. 
the feds have also been known set vpns historically fed resistant locales such the cis middle east and advertise them drug fraud boards. 
even you pay for vpn anonymously and only connect through tor you're making bottleneck where all your traffic goes. 
this lets the vpn profile everything you and that can deanonymizing and itself. 
the thrust posts that you cannot trust vpn providers because they are operated men who can coerced money the laws man turn you. 
you really have way knowing how anonymous you truly are. 
tor however can trusted because it's based the immutable laws mathematics which have regard for the laws man. 
don't quick trust tor. 
although onion garlic mixnet routing solution can theoretically implemented with very low probability anonymization tor's implementation leaves much desired. 
tor has high guarantee anonymity but the codebase has become bloated with backwards compatibility exceptions and inefficient routing behaviors that hypothesize number will become known the next year. 
much traffic correlation analysis tor networks already possible johnson showed his recent paper that average tor user with stable usage patterns can deanonymized after months with probability. 
com publications usersrouted ccs. 
tor does offer the wonderful pluggable transports stenography transforms which recommend clients use may preserve your anonymity obscurity alone most dpi attempts target the lowest common denominator users. 
indeed vpn services alone not provide any guarantee anonymity but tunneling visible tor traffic through vpn may may not provide you with more cover depending the traffic analysis habits your isp governing agency. 
pluggable transports may provide more obscurity although chinese government has recently began successfully thwarting connection attempts obfs bridges dpi. 
assume patterns may extrapolated from any data you send and receive and that your adversaries are highly motivated and funded particularly the united states china and but like tail tor better than whonix tor.

tails stands for the amnesiac incognito live system. 
tails live system that aims preserving your privacy and anonymity. 
helps you use the internet anonymously almost anywhere you and any computer but leave trace using unless you ask explicitly. 
complete operating system designed used from dvd usb stick independently the computer's original operating system. 
free software and based debian gnu linux. 
tails comes with several built applications pre configured with security mind web browser instant messaging client email client office suite image and sound editor etc. 
tails relies the tor anonymity network protect your privacy online the pre installed software configured connect through tor and direct non anonymous connections are blocked. 
tails being constantly updated for security flaws you will need this all over again soon stay safe this comes from the tails website it's very important keep your version tails date otherwise your system will vulnerable numerous security holes. 
the development team doing its best release new versions fixing known security holes regular basis. 
you will need usb thumb drives may pass they are very cheap and available almost everywhere. 
download the latest version the tails. 
iso file from here remember where you save. 
html you are advanced user you can download the cryptographic signature this same page and then verify the download with the tails key from here. 
key download the latest version the linux universal usb installer from here. 
com universal usb installer easy run the newly downloaded universal usb installer read and 'agree to' the disclaimer select tails from the first drop down list it's towards the end the list step browse and select the tails. 
iso file step select your usb drive letter format the drive its not empty already step click 'create' button then wait for finish. 
will few minutes least. 
restart the computer and boot into tails from the usb drive see below for details booting from usb drive booting from usb drive does not automatically boot the usb drive you need select the boot order some newer computers will allow you select which drive boot with small menu without changing bios settings. 
you might instead need edit the bios settings restart your computer and watch for message telling you which key press enter the bios setup. 
will usually one del esc. 
press this key while your computer booting edit your bios settings. 
you need edit the boot order. 
depending your computer you should see entry for 'removable drive' 'usb media'. 
move this the top the list force the computer attempt boot from usb before booting from the hard disk. 
save your changes and continue. 
many flash drives ship usb fdd formatted and some systems will not detect even boot usb fdd. 
most systems can however boot usb zip and usb hdd. 
you are having hard time getting your bios detect your flash drive you can try format usb hdd usb zip using the bootice program similar. 
caution this very advanced program use with caution follow links for the latest version. 
com bootice partition flash drive edit boot sector for more detailed instruction how boot from usb you can read. 
htmif you have problems accessing the bios read this. 
com how access bios any other questions ask away. 
will not accept donations for this tutorial offer this only hope that more people will start using tor. 
you have excess bitcoins you feel like donating worthy cause please send them tor tails. 
org contribute how donate bitcoinnext installing persistent volume alongside liveusb copy tails this why you need two usb drives you should now presented with log prompt for temporary session administration password this reset every time you load tails optional enter this used allow current session access system functions you get any errors about access rights try using admin password log. 
also this point you can optionally select use windows camo 'skin' make tails look more like you're public place for example this also optional. 
once tails and running insert the second usb drive. 
click the 'applications accessories' menu then highlight 'tails' then click 'tails usb installer'. 
click the option clone install select your target device from the drop down menu your second usb drive click 'next' then wait for finish however long copy about usb drive usually few minutes. 
this will install new copy tails onto your second usb drive this will your new proper tails usb. 
shutdown this session tails with the power button the right hand corner. 
don't forget take out the first usb you created and boot into the new second tails usb you can format the first usb drive later that copy tails longer required. 
log the new tails usb once logged click the 'applications' menu then highlight the 'system tools' sub menu then click configure persistent volume. 
the size the persistent volume automatically determined how much left over space the usb drive after installing tails the previous steps. 
choose your pass phrase for the persistent volume you will need enter this every time you login tails. 
the persistent volume encrypted partition protected pass phrase. 
once the persistent volume created you can choose activate not each time you start tails. 
good place store sensitive materials. 
when choosing your pass phrase remember that short easily guessed pass phrases are very easily cracked would take one intel cpu over years brute force crack aes encrypted random character pass phrase using lowercase uppercase characters click create and wait for finish. 
completion window will popup allowing you select what tails will save the new persistent volume automatically internet shortcuts pgp keys nudie pictures application settings etc. 
close and reboot with your modem plugged and switched log back into tails with your new persistent volume. 
make sure your modem plugged and turned click the 'system' menu then highlight the 'preferences' submenu then click 'network connections'. 
now only you know what type internet connection you pay for cannot help you with that personal internet connection was amazingly simple setup was quite surprised its pre configured setups has many different countries options for local telcos pre installed. 
another note tails pre configured through tor pre installed with vidalia and torified browser called 'iceweasel'. 
should automatically open when connected the internet. 
not use the 'iceweasel' browser menu shortcut get onto the road. 
also this operating system not persistent for security measures meaning that any changes you make that are not saved the persistent volume will not saved restarting tails you are now finished feel free click through all the menus and play with the applications. 
this may very well dumb question but i'll for anyways.

from gardener june pmkeep mind that tails comes with firewall set allow only tor traffic. 
this type behavior isn't desirable ubuntu since you want keep your packages updated soon there's security updates firefox patches for security updates for any clearnet web browsing you may over your vpn etc and these firewall rules wouldn't allow ubuntu check for security updates. 
plus unless you configured your iptables firewall just right your vpn couldn't connect either. 
you are ultra paranoid you can actually replicate the amnesiac ness tails like this you can basically install ubuntu update all packages tweak everything just the way you like plus you're going run double vpn get your certs your mullvad client etc set now harden firefox for any clearnet web browsing harden your tor browser for any clearnet web browsing but don't visit any sites either these yet. 
now would attacker has near zero attack surface against your tor browser firefox unless they had zero day exploit for. 
with turning javascript off tor browser this pretty much eliminates their attack surface and you have good web hygiene with noscript firefox and also have flash disabled this also eliminates most would attacker's attack surface. 
now the best part that you can revert your snapshot every time you close your. 
whenever there are any security updates for ubuntu firefox tor browser install your updates without visiting any other websites while the update installing then take new snapshot after the update done. 
you now have what's basically amnesiac system that reverts clean and secure state every time you start. 
bookmarks are pain the ass doing things this way but you are crafty you can export your bookmarks folder share then when you start your again your most recent snapshot you can import your bookmarks and snapshot again. 
would incredibly difficult for the feds compromise your this way even with zero day drive download exploit against firefox ubuntu tor browser. 
since you would just revert fresh start again the next time you started your.

with tails setup your main threat model not compromised dvd but zero day exploit against tor browser. 
with this setup described all you would pretty much ever with your host that point install ubuntu security updates and that's. 
for attacker compromise your host through the you're basically talking about zero day exploit against either tor browser firefox you use noscript correctly plus privilege escalation exploit against your virtual machine software get the bad guy root. 
this basically just not going happen but running everything like this gives you another huge layer security because they'd need the privilege escalation exploit and then also the breakout exploit. 
and they didn't know you everything from vms then the chances attacker having this type breakout exploit against patched ubuntu and date virtual machine software practically non existent. 
we're talking about possibly hundreds hours exploit development work there's even breakout exploit that possible when the patched ubuntu install.

the take homes from this thread are basically. 
keep your moouth shut. 
the feds are going try all types tactics you get you admit guilt the crimes you are being accused. 
they will likely use the good cop bad cop you. 
first they will tell you that they want help you and that they are after the big guys. 
they just need your help put away the big guys. 
not listen this have never cooperated with good cop and have end working favor. 
once you admit being guilty you can kiss your freedom good bye. 
secondly you refuse cooperate their attitude will change bad cop. 
they will say fine you not want cooperate tried help but now you are going lot trouble. 
you have any idea what kind charges you are facing you are going away for long time unless you start talking. 
they are going try and scare you into admitting guilt. 
again keep your mouth shut and continue ask for lawyer hopefully the one you put retainer prior this happening. 
never speak without lawyer present and never anything you not have legally. 
you have the right remain silent then exercise that right. 
know there are some circumstances which you not have that right but unless that the case you are better off staying quiet. 
third drop the attitude. 
not argue with the cops about having nothing you something for that matter. 
act scared anxious and confused. 
act like you have idea what going and that you are scared for your life. 
tell the cops they are scaring you and you want see your lawyer because you not know what this about. 
they need evidence and solid evidence that charge you with crime. 
they are going try and correlate posts you made forums phone numbers you called perhaps package shipped your home all forms communication bank transfers and forth until they can find way link you the crime you are being accused. 
but the biggest piece evidence will always your willingness admit your guilt for lesser sentence. 
when sabu found that was facing years federal prison quickly spilled everything and started working for the feds. 
again talk your lawyer find out the evidence against you and only answers questions your lawyer advises you answer and answer them way your lawyer advises you answer them. 
try and honest possible with your lawyer. 
your lawyer can not and will not share any admittance guilt you have with the prosecutors this called attorney client privilege. 
please note there are few instances where this does not apply. 
org wiki attorney client privilege when the privilege may not apply.

ulbricht guilty silk road online drug trafficking trialjury convicts seven counts doesn believe ulbricht was just the fall guy. 
joe mullin feb utcnew york jury wednesday convicted ross ulbricht federal charges accusing him being the mastermind behind the online drug silk road where hundreds millions dollars illegal goods were traded before law enforcement shuttered the site late. 
the jury twelve reached its guilty verdicts all seven counts after deliberating less than four hours. 
ulbricht faces life prison. 
sentenced separate proceeding few months. 
the seven charges include three drug counts distributing aiding and abetting the distribution narcotics distributing narcotics aiding and abetting distribution over the internet and conspiracy violate narcotics laws. 
was also convicted fourth count conspiracy run continuing criminal enterprise which involves supervising least five other people organization. 
addition was convicted conspiracy charges for computer hacking distributing false identification and money laundering. 
the verdict was handed district judge katherine forrest manila envelope. 
she gave her court clerk who read out. 
the judge then polled each juror asking them verbally concur the verdict. 
the verdict was read ulbricht father kirk ulbricht held his head. 
midway through the reading ulbricht turned face his family and friends who filled about two rows courtroom benches. 
after was read ulbricht was taken out the room the same two federal marshals who led him each day the trial. 
not the end ulbricht mother lyn ulbricht said her son was escorted from the courtroom. 
several other relatives front rows simply shouted out quick goodbye. 
the back the gallery supporter shouted ross hero the year old ulbricht who the authorities said made millions dollars commissions put brief defense just three character witnesses during the three week criminal trial. 
ulbricht defense attorney joshua dratel told reporters gathered outside the courthouse that plans appeal. 
dratel said the judge presiding over the trial hampered his defense excluding evidence and witnesses position echoed the defendant mother. 
the defense was shackled she told reporters gathered outside the courthouse after the verdict. 
dratel didn say much about the negotiations before the trial but did say the government didn make meaningful offer that would have reduced ulbricht possible sentence. 
the trial proceeded over days spread over three weeks. 
during closing arguments tuesday dratel told jurors that the data authorities seized from ulbricht computer connecting him the site could have been created others. 
the internet not what seems told the six woman six man panel. 
dratel has said his client who did not take the stand had created the site but was the fall guy for the site real operators. 
prosecutors countered dratel telling jurors there was mountain evidence that ulbricht was the dread pirate roberts. 
thousands pages chats with silk road admins and other management documents were recovered from his open laptop. 
there dispute when the defendant was arrested was logged dread pirate roberts prosecutor serrin turner told jurors. 
there were little elves that put all that evidence the defendant computer.

introduction secure communication tor sslgreetings comrades. 
through research have put together some security measures that should considered everyone. 
the reason put this together mainly for the newbies this forum. 
but can help anyone out then grateful for this. 
would like start out saying you are reading like you are likely silk road user. 
this the case then the thing you must using even access this form tor. 
tor will provide you with degree anonymity using bit aes advanced encryption standard. 
there has been some debate whether not the nsa can crack this code and the answer likely yes. 
this why you should never send anything over tor that you aren comfortable sharing with the entire world unless you are using some sort pgp encryption which will talk about later. 
communication from your computer the internet relies entry node which basically enters your computer into the tor network. 
this entry node communicates with your computer this entry node knows your address. 
the entry node then passes your encrypted request onto the relay node. 
the relay node communicates with the entry node and the exit node but does not know your computer address. 
the exit node where your request decrypted and sent the internet. 
the exit node does not know your computer only the the relay node. 
using this model nodes makes harder but not impossible correlate your request your original address. 
the problem comes obviously when you are entering plain text into tor because anybody can set exit node. 
the fbi can set exit node the nsa any other foreign government any malicious person who may want steal your information. 
you should not entering any sensitive data into any websites especially when accessing them over tor. 
any the nodes the chain are compromised and some likely are and the people charge those compromised nodes have the computing power decrypt your request then you better hope wasn anything sensitive. 
what can fix this well luckily are now having more and more servers that are offering something called hidden services. 
you can easily recognize these services the address. 
these services offer what called end end encryption. 
what this does take the power out the compromised exit nodes and put them back your hands. 
the web server the hidden service now becomes your exit node which means the website you are visiting the one decrypting your message not some random exit node ran potential attacker. 
remember the exit node has the key decrypt your request. 
the exit node can see what you are sending clear text once they decrypt. 
you are entering your name and address into field the exit node has your information. 
you are putting credit card bank account your real name even your login information then you are compromising your identity. 
another step you can take only visit websites that use something called http secure. 
you can tell the website you are visiting using http secure the prefix the beginning the address. 
you see then your website using http secure. 
what this does encrypts your requests that only the server can decrypt them and not somebody eavesdropping your communication such compromised tor exit node. 
this another form end end encryption. 
somebody were intercept your request over http secure they would see encrypted data and would have work decrypt. 
another reason you want use whenever possible that malicious tor nodes can damage alter the contents passing through them insecure fashion and inject malware into the connection. 
this particularly easier when you are sending requests plain text but reduces this possibility. 
you must made aware however that can also currently cracked depending the level the key used encrypt. 
when you visit website using you are encrypting your request using their public key and they are decrypting using their private key. 
this how cryptography works. 
public key provided those who want send encrypted message and the only one who can decrypt the one with the private key. 
unfortunately many websites today are still using private keys that are only bits long which today world are longer enough. 
you need make sure you find out which level encryption the website you are visiting uses make sure they are using minimum not bits. 
even doing all this unfortunately not enough because have another problem. 
what happens the web server itself has become compromised maybe your tor nodes are clean maybe you have used for all your requests but the web server itself the website you are visiting has been compromised. 
well then all your requests are again good plain text. 
with that being said this will conclude the first post this series the steps can take protect our privacy online remain anonymous and maintain our freedom. 
doesn break the transaction chain shouldn used own. 
but good combo with different mixing methods.

pgp comes into play because uses very strong method encryption called cryptography. 
pgp stands for pretty good privacy and used for encrypting decrypting and signing texts mails files directories and whole disk partitions and increase the security mail communications. 
for the more technical users uses serial combination hashing data compression symmetric key cryptography and finally public key cryptography. 
for the less technical users the process encrypting messages using pgp follows. 
you create private key and public key. 
the public key the key you give out people you want send you encrypted messages. 
your private key kept privately you. 
this private key the only key that can unlock messages that were previously locked with your public key. 
you are still confused think about like this. 
think about public key that can around locking boxes that are intended for you. 
anyone can lock box that intended for you but you are the only one with the key unlock the box. 
either the person who sent you message locked box message with your public key they themselves can not unlock. 
only the person possessing the private key can unlock. 
you wish respond this person you must use their public key encrypt the message you intend send them. 
and they themselves use their own private key decrypt the message you sent them. 
you are still with glad haven lost you yet. 
this called cryptography and was designed that anybody intercepting your message could not decrypt the message without your private key. 
even you yourself lose your private key there method key recovery. 
you can consider that message locked forever. 
how you use pgp well before get that want introduce you live operating system which makes using pgp encryption and decryption very easy. 
live operating system operating system that you can run top your current operating system. 
for example you are windows user you have choices. 
you can download the live operating system burn dvd and then boot your computer from that dvd. 
this will make sure your computer run you have this operating system installed your computer. 
however you remove the dvd and reboot then your computer will boot normal. 
you can also use usb drive perform this same feature. 
secondly you can run this live operating system what called virtual box. 
the benefits this are that you can run windows simultaneously you run this other operating system and you can easily switch back and forth between them without rebooting the computer. 
both methods have their pros and cons. 
the pros running live boot are that reduce the risk having your computer compromised viruses malware and keyloggers that rely windows run. 
you are going run this from virtual box suggest downloading virtual box from oracle. 
org next the live operating system would encourage you use tails. 
tails can found the following website. 
org the reason choose tails because has many the security features that you require stay anonymous already installed. 
some users are not happy with tails but really great operating system loaded with security features. 
many will talk about this series security including pgp encryption and decryption. 
make sure you download the tails iso file from the official tails website and you can either load into virtual box burn dvd load onto usb and booting your computer from that drive. 
there are plenty tutorials how load tails into virtual box won into much detail other than make sure you run virtual box and tails from usb drive card. 
would suggest usb drive however for reasons will explain later. 
but basically when when virtual box runs directly your hard drive creates virtual hard drive that uses temporary hard drive while tails running. 
once tails closed this virtual drive deleted but not permanently deleted. 
know from the power recovery tools deleted files are easily recoverable with the right tools. 
will talk about how protect your files from data recovery tools future posts but for now just keep virtual box and tails off your hard drive and load either usb drive card. 
the same goes when booting your computer directly into tails from dvd usb stick. 
your hard drive will used store files used tails make sure any files that are saved accessed using tails are done from usb stick card otherwise they will recoverable. 
this why prefer using virtual box and running both the virtual box and tails inside off usb stick. 
keep much possible off your actual hard drive. 
possible shred files beyond recovery but much easier this flash drive then hard drive.

which brings next topic. 
file shredding extremely important and here why. 
you delete file from your computer you are only deleting where located the drive. 
still the actual drive just location data has been removed. 
you take file recovery tool you can recover virtually any file that you have recently removed. 
file shredding combats this overwriting files instead. 
the idea that instead removing the file location you need overwrite the file with random data that becomes unrecoverable. 
there are lot debate happening whether you can overwrite file once you need multiple times. 
supposedly the nsa recommends times supposedly the department defense recommends times and old paper man named peter gutmann written the recommended times. 
needless say personally think between times sufficient and several people out there believe time will get the job done. 
the reasoning behind this that some people believe the drive may miss some files the first time over writes them and more complete you should multiple passes. 
what you feel most comfortable with but even think passes would sufficient although wouldn hurt every now and then run passes and just leave overnight. 
the programs that can file shredding are ones you will want run from windows whatever operating system your computer running. 
these programs can delete your files from your recycling bin delete your temporary internet files and even wipe your free disk space make sure everything gets cleaned. 
you always need think did have any sensitive material hard drive maybe need shred free disk space. 
when empting your recycle bin you should always use shredder. 
when only deleting under time you can easily passes pretty quickly. 
put this perspective the leader group called lulzsec name topiary has been banned part his sentence from using any type file shredding applications that the fbi wants check him they can. 
file shredding keeps your deleted files actually deleted. 
here are some file shredding applications you can use.

are pleased announce that alphabay market now supports multisig transactions this was requested long time ago the community decided step our game bit and for this option. 
are now the only marketplace the deepweb having all the following security measures source deepdotweb marketplace list multisig transactions withdrawal pin vendor bond forced vendor pgpfor the less tech inclined here how multisig transaction works both the buyer and the seller must have set their public multisig key their profile. 
the buyer deposits the item value his alphabay wallet cover market fees. 
the buyer purchases the item then multisig blond wig address generated using the buyer key seller key and market generated public key. 
both parties can use this publicly viewable information verify the authenticity the address. 
the buyer sends money this address and the seller ships the goods. 
the buyer happy finalizes and the seller received the market private key. 
case dispute refund the buyer receives the private key. 
whoever got the private key will use along with his own private key claim the coins. 
make simple buy the product and you get btc address send the coins. 
seller gets the private key when you finalize. 
you get the key you dispute and win. 
this fool proof method avoid exit scams. 
you never give your private keys anyone.

javascript and removing personal metadata from fileswelcome back. 
before get into removing harmful meta data from your files want talk about another vulnerability our browsing capabilities called javascript. 
mid person ireland was providing hosting people that hosted hidden services including secure email platform called tor mail. 
unfortunately they busted him unrelated charge relating child pornography and seized all his servers. 
whether not was related child porn not unknown could silly charge the feds slapped him with but either way the feds ended injecting malicious javascript into his servers that when users would visit certain sites this malicious code would execute their computers and reveal information about their computers the feds. 
suggest you read the following article learn more about this. 
net with that being said you may want disable javascript your browsers especially when visiting certain websites like silk road that may become compromised one day. 
many users refuse visit the original silk road website and forums with javascript enabled because the feds likely injected with malicious javascript identify users. 
tails the browser called iceweasel and when tor ran windows uses firefox. 
both browsers can disable javascript using the exact same method. 
open window and type the following command the address bar about config and click the button that says careful promise. 
this will bring bunch settings including search bar the top. 
enter javascript the search bar and look for the following two entries javascript. 
right click these and click toggle and you will see the value changed false. 
you want enable javascript again just click toggle again and you will see the value change back true. 
again remember that every time you restart tails you will have this again get into habit doing this every time. 
you never know when your favorite website could become compromised. 
moving onto meta data. 
there bit famous story about online hacker named rmer that would take pictures his girlfriend and post them online after would deface webpage. 
what either forgot didn know was that photos taken with the iphone and other smart phones save the gps coordinates where the picture was taken and store the meta data the picture. 
check out this article below. 
rmer you need remove this meta data otherwise you could end federal prison with rmer. 
luckily tails has solution for this see why love tails applications accessories metadata anonymisation toolkit please get more clear idea how this works reading the following page. 
org please note the currently supported formats. 
terms pictures jpg jpeg and png. 
but unfortunately mat not perfect and wouldn solely rely better idea would never upload pictures yourself your significant other online especially bragging about hack you committed. 
please read the site provided above for more information.

gpg win kleopatra gpa are also deprecated kleopatra generates rsa keys without encryption sub key.

from january pmi did try this typed the text that want encrypt and saved the text file the desktop. 
the reason that the file when you attempt edit looks like hieroglyphics because the file not ascii armoured. 
files that are encrypted and not ascii armoured usually end. 
here how work properly for you these instructions assume you already generated your own pgp key and have saved both the public and private halves external storage. 
remember tails amnesic meaning that you don backup your data keyrings they will not there for you the next time you fire tails. 
this follow these steps. 
click places computer the top menu. 
new window will pop with series locations devices the left and list folders the right. 
plug your usb stick micro card. 
recognized the device will appear the list devices the left hand pane. 
terminal session will then open. 
the prompt will look something like this amnesia amnesia. 
issue the command media amnesia. 
issue the command you will see folder directory with its name blue perhaps something like where the the device identifier folder name. 
issue the command switch into that folder. 
issue the command copy your secret keys single file gpg armour export secret keys secret keys. 
issue the command copy your public keys single file gpg armour export public keys. 
ascyour pgp keys are now backed onto external media you will have them ready for use the next time you fire tails. 
now far encrypting messages goes. 
click the little clipboard icon the top menu bar and select open text editor the last entry. 
the editor compose your text encrypted. 
when you done composing use control select all the text and control copy the clipboard. 
click the little clipboard icon again only this time select the second option sign encrypt clipboard with public keys. 
select rcipients box will pop and you can put check the left most checkbox select the recipients. 
click encrypt the contents the clipboard with the selected public keys. 
when the contents the clipboard are encrypted you will see little padlock icon superimposed the clipboard. 
click the clipboard icon again select open text editor and right click wiht your mouse and choose paste. 
copy your ascii armored encrypted message will seen there. 
the message can pasted anywhere else you need. 
copy the encrypted message the clipboard. 
click the clipboard icon chosing the first option decrypt verify clipboard. 
new dialog box will pop asking for your passphrase. 
new screen will then pop showing you your decrypted text. 
this text can copied and pasted wherever you need.

combining tor with vpn continuedok now let talk about why you may want connect vpn over tor. 
the data flow would look like this. 
you tor vpn internet the benefits doing that are follows. 
you are more anonymous your vpn case they happen keep logs you something using the vpn that you are not supposed and website server grabs your vpn address. 
the case this happening even the vpn manages keep logs everything you they can only identify you anonymous tor user long you did not purchase the service like idiot with your credit card paypal account. 
you use blond wig and made sure the the blond wig trail not easily traceable you should okay. 
some websites block tor users from connecting their websites servers using your vpn appear the exit node you are hiding your tor activity from the website you are visiting and hopefully bypassing their filters. 
another advantage that your vpn connection does drop your fall back will your tor address instead your real address. 
and finally you are passing through compromised tor exit node your information will remain encrypted through the vpn encryption protocol until reaches the exit node the vpn. 
this good thing you are passing through compromised exit node but not forget that the vpn could logging everything you are doing anyways. 
not trust anybody who has access your unecrypted data few the downsides doing things this way mentioned the previous post are that your isp knows you are using tor when and for how long. 
this may may not matter you but just something consider. 
second you will unable visit hidden services websites. 
onion sites talked about the beginning you need connected the tor network visit those hidden service websites. 
but connected tor aren yes you are but your final method communicating with the internet does not come from the tor network comes from your vpn. 
and your vpn likely not configured for tor. 
order for you able connect hidden services you must either connected directly tor use vpn connect tor. 
tor must your final node connectivity order visit onion websites. 
the choice ultimately you and every person every state province and country will have different reasons for wanting vpn tor tor vpn just tor just vpn. 
whatever choice you make please keep all the things mentioned this post and the previous post mind. 
none these methods will save you you enter anything identifying about yourself online. 
not log into your facebook account using your vpn. 
not check your email search nearby address google using your vpn. 
fact stay away from google altogether unless absolutely necessary. 
there are two other search engines out now that not store information about their users. 
they have both clearnet url and hidden services url for both types users. 
onion please note the hidden services mirror not startpage. 
this server also does not store any information about its users. 
com before move want back how choose good vpn. 
when looking for vpn provider you will most likely come across two protocols choose from. 
find out which one your vpn provider using before you sign with them. 
this time going highly recommend that you avoid pptp and stick with openvpn providers. 
check out this site for quick comparison. 
com vyprvpn openvpn pptp you can see pptp uses weaker encryption bit versus bit bit for openvpn. 
offers basic security versus high level security using something called digital certificates. 
this basically way make sure they data coming sent from your vpn provider and not injected some malicious third party because the incoming and outgoing data are signed using specially obtained certificates similar showing your get into restricted area. 
the only downside that setting openvpn can little challenging for the less technical users but there are plenty great tutorials online set openvpn providers and your vpn provider itself will likely help you get set well. 
pptp has been abandoned those who demand the highest level security would recommend avoid. 
third option for vpn providers ipsec but many users now believe has also been compromised the nsa due its weaker levels encryption and should avoided well. 
lastly you want know how connect tor over vpn. 
you are using openvpn like recommended then you really quite simple. 
make sure you are connected your vpn check your address any website such. 
com make sure has changed. 
then open tor open tails and start using tor and you are now connected tor over vpn. 
connecting vpn over tor more tricky and currently above skill set since openvpn reconfigures your network routes tor can running the same host. 
soon figure out will post tutorial and anybody can share easy way connect vpn over tor then please share with this thread. 
updatea method connecting vpn over tor has been added this thread but currently only able used windows users. 
you can read about the link below. 
connecting tor vpn for windows usersafter long search have found way you can connect tor vpn. 
not perfect and some might not agree with doing things this way but works and giving you option but only works for windows users this time. 
you look back previous posts regarding combining vpn and tor then you will find the reasons why you would want and some the reasons why you might not want. 
but was unable provide you with way connect vpn using tor that the vpn does not know who you are. 
when comes tor vpn you cannot trust your vpn which you rarely should then keeping your identity anonymous from your vpn good idea. 
also with more and more people using tor but with only around tor exit nodes many the exit node addresses are being flagged spammers popular websites and limiting the usage well meaning tor users post message boards like stack exchange and forth. 
the way that found you can tor vpn using virtual machine preferrably virtual box and running another instance windows preferrably one that uses less memory than your current version. 
you also want run tor expert and tortilla your host. 
talk about how this previous posts. 
next set your virtual box route all network traffic through tortilla bridge adapter which routes all through tor. 
currently tortilla only supported windows which why this option only available windows users this time. 
doing this also makes easier things like watch videos youtube. 
now that you have your windows virtual machine running tor you can install vpn your choice preferrably one using openvpn your windows guest and connect. 
check your address before connecting and after and you should see different address. 
all went well you now have virtual machine running tor vpn. 
then you want add another layer you can download tor browser bundle onto your virtual machine and run that well giving you tor vpn tor for another layer security. 
also you have the option using this method use vpn your host then tor expert with tortilla then another vpn your guest then tor browser giving you vpn tor vpn tor. 
not advocating any whcih method you need make that decision your own just giving you the knowledge necesary make informed decison and you can ultimately choose which method you feel most comfortable with. 
sometimes doing tor vpn necessary because the spam filter reasons mentioned above and other times having tor your last node the internet necessary like when accessing the onion network. 
completely you and know that are trying shy away from windows usage because all the exploits and other reasons spoken about the previous posts but you have other way staying anonymous from your vpn than this then think good compromise until have something like tortilla that compatible with linux distributions.

exif datai forgot mention above when talking about metadata that when comes photos there another risk involved called exif data this another form meta data specifically related images and may not properly removed metadata anonymisation toolkit mentioned before. 
exif data stands for exchangeable image file format and affects jpg jpef tif and wav files. 
photo taken with gps enabled camera can reveal the exact location and time was taken and the unique number the device this all done default often without the user knowledge. 
december anti virus programmer john mcafee was arrested guatemala while fleeing from alleged persecution belize which shares border. 
vice magazine had published exclusive interview with mcafee the run that included photo mcafee with vice reporter taken with phone that had geotagged the image. 
the photo metadata included gps coordinates locating mcafee guatemala and was captured two days later. 
avoid this only take photos that use png because does not store exif data. 
check your photo has any revealing exif data attached check out this site. 
com you can download tool doing quick search online see what exif data may contained your photos before you upload them. 
very careful with any files that you upload online because you never know what type harmful data could attached them. 
helps use tails but always consider everything you put online potential piece evidence used against you and always prepare for the day the feds come your door.

what bridges are and when use them when using tor with tails its default configuration anyone who can observe the traffic your internet connection for example your internet service provider and perhaps your government and law enforcement agencies can know that you are using tor. 
this may issue you are country where the following applies. 
using tor blocked censorship since all connections the internet are forced through tor this would render tails useless for everything except for working offline documents etc. 
using tor dangerous considered suspicious this case starting tails its default configuration might get you into serious trouble. 
tor bridges also called tor bridge relays are alternative entry points the tor network that are not all listed publicly. 
using bridge makes harder but not impossible for your internet service provider know that you are using tor. 
org doc first steps startup options bridge mode index. 
htmlthe first thing are going get some bridges. 
let this before configure tails use bridges because once tails bridge mode will not able connect tor without working bridges. 
the first thing want visit the following webpage. 
org bridges you may wish look your bridge before you use however. 
maybe you want find out where your bridge located maybe you want see who hosting the bridge and you can this looking for look service online doing search and typing the address. 
and with that you can decide which bridge would better choice for you use. 
now when opening the tor browser you have already configured once you will need into tor browser browser and open tor browser setup while tor finding relays click the settings buttonsfor google yahoo and mit email users you can send email with get bridges subject the official email address tor bridges torproject. 
org then you will get three newest bridges once. 
now there are options would like connect directly the tor network this computer internet connection censored proxied. 
click configure does your internet service provider isp block otherwise censor connections the tor network choose yes click next. 
click enter custom bridges and import your bridges. 
click next your computer does not connect through proxy select hit connect. 
check this site out which may help you figure out what happened. 
could simple needed update. 
net utils blue screen view. 
scans all your minidump files created during blue screen death crashes and displays the information about all crashes one table. 
for each crash bluescreenview displays the minidump filename the date time the crash the basic crash information displayed the blue screen bug check code and parameters and the details the driver module that possibly caused the crash filename product name file description and file version. 
for each crash displayed the upper pane you can view the details the device drivers loaded during the crash the lower pane. 
bluescreenview also mark the drivers that their addresses found the crash stack you can easily locate the suspected drivers that possibly caused the crash.

yes possible run electrum through tor. 
use the following network settings after clicking the green red circle the bottom right corner auto connect off fill one the. 
onion electrum servers such ajsstuovkutzn. 
onion drp pvejybx ejdr. 
onion with port proxy socks localhost this should allow you connect. 
that depends how you use. 
remember you will automatically send list all the addresses your electrum wallet the electrum server you connect. 
this how electrum knows the correct btc amount each address since you don store the blockchain yourself. 
would advise regularly generate new electrum wallet and certainly not connect your clean electrum bitcoin wallet via tor. 
also try install electrum hidden volume use tails since your electrum wallets containing all used addresses and recent servers are saved your electrum data folder. 
you can improve general security better obscurity using bitcoin mixer. 
this will make the path your bitcoins less obvious but again all depends the service you use and how you make use. 
sigaint shared that the hub users who access tor hidden services websites that are only accessible inside the tor anonymity network easier than anonymizing users who use tor access regular internet websites. 
security researchers filipo valsorda and george tankersley showed friday the hack the box security conference amsterdam why tor connections hidden services are more vulnerable traffic correlation attacks. 
one tor primary goals provide anonymity for internet users. 
this achieved routing their web traffic through series randomly chosen nodes relays before passing back onto the public internet. 
the nodes that make the tor network are run volunteers and they can have specialized roles. 
there are nodes called entry guards that serve the first hops onto the network and there are also exit relays that pass the traffic back onto the internet. 
internet servers that receive traffic from tor users won see the real internet protocol addresses those users. 
what they see will the addresses randomly chosen tor exit nodes. 
the tor hidden service protocol extends the anonymity protection servers well. 
makes impossible for users see the real address server that runs tor hidden service like for example website. 
hidden services use addresses that end. 
onion pseudo top level domain that doesn exist the internet and only resolves inside the tor network. 
this anonymity protection for both servers and users makes hidden services attractive political activists countries where free speech not well protected where internet surveillance common but also criminals who use such websites hide their activities from law enforcement. 
the infamous online silk road where users sold drugs arms and other kinds illegal goods and services operated tor hidden service. 
the fbi eventually shut down and arrested its owner but other similar marketplaces have taken its place. 
the biggest threat the tor network which exists design its vulnerability traffic confirmation correlation attacks. 
this means that attacker gains control over many entry and exit relays they can perform statistical traffic analysis determine which users visited which websites. 
the tor developers are closely monitoring exit relays and removing bad ones from the network relatively hard for someone pull off such attack. 
addition attacker wants identify tor users visiting specific internet website they have gain control over very large number exit and entry nodes order increase their chance success since the relays will different for every connection. 
that not the case with tor hidden services and fact attackers could quite easily and with percent reliability take control all the rendezvous points between tor users and specific tor hidden services least for period time. 
tor hidden services rely nodes with special hsdir hidden service directory flag advertise themselves the tor network they can discovered users. 
every hidden service will select six hsdir nodes serve its rendezvous points given day. 
this selection done from pool around nodes based predictable date dependent formula. 
with this formula both tor client and tor hidden service should select the same hsdirs particular day. 
however the researchers found that they could use brute force techniques generate the keys needed for their own nodes take those rendezvous positions for specific day. 
the researchers managed place their own nodes the hsdirs for. 
onion facebook official site the tor network for the whole day thursday. 
they still held the spots friday. 
brute forcing the key for each node took only minutes macbook pro and running the tor relays themselves cost amazon service. 
new nodes receive the hsdir flag automatically after being for around five days and attackers could set nodes become the hsdirs for particular hidden service for the next five days with around the researchers estimated. 
this technique will give attackers control over one end the connection but order perform traffic correlation attacks the attacker would also need have visibility into the entry point. 
this can achieved someone who can monitor users traffic before enters the tor network. 
for example government monitoring its internet users through isps could use this attack perform traffic analysis and determine who visited dissident site hosted tor. 
law enforcement agency could the same with the help isps identify who visiting illegal website that runs tor hidden service. 
the goal the two researchers was prove that hidden service users face greater risk targeted anonymization than normal tor users because much easier reliably control all hsdirs for specific hidden service than control all tor exit relays that might used access website. 
runa sandvik security researcher and former tor developer who was the conference agreed that technically easier pull off such attack than monitor tor exit traffic but pointed out that the tor project aware the issue and has been working fix for some time. 
there proposal for the next generation hidden services that will address not only this problem but also other potential issues sandvik said. 
the meantime the tor developers have tools that can detect relays trying attack users tor hidden services she said. 
change tor that will implemented soon will make harder for new nodes become hsdirs forcing them obtain stable flag first valsorda and tankersley said. 
this will require nodes online for longer period time before they can become hsdirs will make the attack more expensive but not technically harder pull off they said. 
while users can much defend themselves against this the operators tor hidden services have one option. 
they could use the attack themselves that their own nodes will become hsdirs for their own hidden services. 
this won prevent others from trying take over the rendezvous positions because the attack essentially race condition. 
however this happens will very easy detect that attack going the researchers explained. 
they released the brute force tool they created for the attack github well separate hsdir analysis tool that can potentially detect such attacks. 
article tor connections hidden services could easy anonymize github link. 
com filosottile hstoolsvendors careful you decide setup your own shopel presidente said the hub from presidentethis was first publicised donncha cearbhaill mid. 
described this technique and published some code since removed for calculating the relay key necessary become hsdir for given given time. 
trawling tor hidden services looked silkroadvb piz amongst othersit good remind people but kind suprised this made the news again. 
will chime with our standard response which isrun your own guards use guards you trust. 
anyone got invite for this little one.
